item.title: "Here, in the IT department, at Monaco RV, many of our tasks/projects are isolated from the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Here, in the IT department, at Monaco RV, many of our tasks/projects are isolated from the larger company IT department but there have been some areas that company has taken over or partnered with our department. From my position as a DBA I see the main business value provided now to our department is the certainty and security that we can weather the storms which can be of great value in actual work product because people will and can focus more on their work. Also, while certain areas have been absorbed by the parent IT department, many of the services provided by our department are enhanced by the addition of people and the corporate oversight that comes with being a part of company."

item.title: "I don't think the current ticket creation process (by calling 1300) is value added. Often I ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I don't think the current ticket creation process (by calling 1300) is value added. Often I have to call up 1300 and explain the issue, more often than not, this ticket is forwarded to the local support team. The ticket that is sent to the local support team often includes a very brief description of the issue, so I have to take time to explain the issue all over to the onsite support person. There used to a option to go online and create tickets using a web based interface, and this process was far more efficient. A web based tool for ticket creation and status tracking will be value added. "

item.title: "IT is not providing a clear business value. Instead of improving our systems to work faster ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT is not providing a clear business value. Instead of improving our systems to work faster or more efficiently the intent is to keep going for the big ""sea change"" Case in point. Our drawing viewer, CadSearch, has to be one of the most archaic viewers in existience, but no work has been done to improve it. Teamcenter, which is a good data manager, is being toughted as the new viewer even though it takes at least 5 minutes to login assuming that you can log in at all due to numerous ""unable to bind"" errors. Please upgrade CadSearch or Pharos and use it instead of pushing Teamcenter as the cure for all our ills."

item.author: No author info
item.description: "Our systems for drawing approval and release function well, but seem to be lacking in efficiency. For example, to look up a part number it can be done in Teamcenter, Part Trak, PIQ, and PHAROS and all parts may not be in all databases. Some of it is ITAR related, which I understand to a point, but other differences are because the databases don't talk to each other. There should be one, unified part database."

I would prefer to have a specific contact for our DC office whom I may contact at any time. I usually end up fixing my IT issue through research before I am able to connect with a member of the IT staff."

item.title: "IT needs to communicate WISE models, and what it means to business, but really work on ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT needs to communicate WISE models, and what it means to business, but really work on the new and emerging technologies piece. What does SOA mean for business? Why is there so much shadow IT working on workflow in SharePoint - why isn't there a workflow tool strategy or BPMS plan being communicated? How can company leverage mobile apps as part of strategy to grow business and improve customer satisfaction? Technologies like telematics aren't coming from IT - they come from engineering. What other technologies are out there and why does business care?"

item.description: "If IT is responsible for laptop selection then I would disagree. I have been issued an 8440p and am expected to run MATLAB and IDEAS. I have needlessly spent nearly 60 extra hours becuase the computer runs out of memory and crashes, forcing me to start over and try to split the files, which is less valuable to the company and nearly 3 times more time consuming. --If It is not responsible for this, then I would rank them as 3."

item.title: "Big issues with planview process. Requests are submitted and stay in submittal status until you ping ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Big issues with planview process. Requests are submitted and stay in submittal status until you ping someone. No one seems measured on how many requests are assigned to them, time to resolve. Requests are submitted, and aren't discussed with appropriate BRCL representation - requests are assigned to who works on the app, not the business person who submitted request. The submitter might not be on BRCL that reviews request. Many definitions within planview aren't defined and are up to users discretion when allocating time so metrics will be bogus. When I am teaching a class, should I enter it as non-project training, group communications, or some other bucket. If management doesn't define it, you can automate planview routing all you want but still not improve it."

item.description: "The only reason I am choosing 4 is because every company needs an IT department. I believe our is soarly lacking. If they'd start making wiser decisions about the software they have us use. Peoplesoft is just about the worst program/software that I have ever used. To look up a PO in Project Phoenix you end up with 3 internet sessions running? I know it's not called Project Phoenix, but that is what I know it as (or Oracle). Then when you open it you get a security warning of some sort, but it's okay to continue??? I don't know, but that doesn't make a lot of sense to me. It seems as though there's alway ""band-aids"" or quick fixes put in place. My biggest concern is when they replace the pricing system and then TOLAS. What band-aids will we need for that?"

item.title: The people at the 800# are not only hard to understand at times but also lack ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The people at the 800# are not only hard to understand at times but also lack the ability to properly understand what the issue is when I call most of the times. Tickets have been issued with the wrong description and issues not resolved with 1 phone call. In May I called twice about 2 separate issues & advised the person I was working from home & needed to be called back on my cell phone. 4 times the 800# person told me that someone would call my office number about the issue even after I told them I wasn't in the office & to only reference my cell phone number. For the one issue someone in local IT contacted my office number & got my manager's ph# from my voice mail & called him about my ticket. My manager was unaware of the issue & therefore the ticket was not resolved. For the 2nd example I again told the 800# person I was out of the office & needed to be called on my cell phone. 3 days later I received an email from an internal IT person asking me to contact him about my issue. I questioned why no one had called me at home as I requested on the ticket when I called on 5/23. He replied that there was no home or cell ph# listed on the ticket. I am very disappointed at the 800# people. This is just a couple examples of the problems I have experienced. When you ask around everyone says the only time they call the 800# is if absolutely needed as it is a waste of time as issues are not resolved due to lack of response or the person at the 800# doesn't understand the issue & issue a ticket appropriately.

item.title: "I get automated email requests when I call the help desk in timely manner, but doesn't ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I get automated email requests when I call the help desk in timely manner, but doesn't really say anything. Receiving my request doesn't mean it's being looked at. I get email again when it's assigned a ticket number, which I guess means it's being looked at, and then again when resolution is closed. Sometimes I get emails again weeks later after ticket number is assigned - it was routed to someone else, issue was resolved, but never closed out. Why wait 3-4 weeks to ask if it's been resolved instead of sooner? Are there any SLAs in place that are aligned with when we need it resolved by? Could ask customer when they need issue resolved, but would be surprised if anyone ever said anything other than asap."

item.title: "When it comes to projects or tweaks to something that already exists, there is not much ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When it comes to projects or tweaks to something that already exists, there is not much communication as to status. This is true for almost all IT issues that are put into the larger IT infrastructure (e.g. Planview). If it is a project that requires any kind of work, it seems to be difficult to track and not much follow up, if any, is initiated by IT. There also seems to be too much compartmentalism - and when one follows up, it is 'this group does this task and another group does another task'. This arrangement doesn't seem very efficient. "

item.title: "I am an AME employee based in Melrose Park. Upon a trip to Huntsville, I realized ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am an AME employee based in Melrose Park. Upon a trip to Huntsville, I realized I forgot my power adapter for my laptop. I asked a level 7 at Huntsville for help and he went to local IT and gave me a power adapter and said, ""you can keep it"". A MONTH LATER....he came to me and asked for it back saying, ""you are not a Huntsville employee, IT requires that you return the power adapter."" THIS IS CRAZY, DO WE WORK FOR THE SAME COMPANY OR NOT? A $60 power adapter is not going to break anybody's budget. How can we be a $20Billion company if we can't figure out how to either cross charge other departments or allow small charges like this to be incurred?"

item.title: "I am in a unique position that requires much more IT support and unique IT support ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am in a unique position that requires much more IT support and unique IT support for engineering level product testing. At least one local liason would improve our relationship with IT greatly. I know it isn't easy but it does cost us testing down time when we have to wait for overseas support to contact local support. Time is relative I know but there is a difference between ""knowing"" someone is working on your problem and ""wondering"" if someone is working on your problem."

item.title: "Some of the IT functions are not aligned with business goals, priorities, and objectives. For example, ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Some of the IT functions are not aligned with business goals, priorities, and objectives. For example, migrating from Ideas to NX and pulling away engineering resources to train and test and migrate and validate all the aspects that this effort merits. While the effort is one that will add value (potentially) the timing and implementation clash with major engine programs that are critical to the business as a corporation. The ""blue chips"" are not first (e.i. 0.2NoX engine programs fully resources), so we can offer EPA compliant engines to customers in 2012. Once these critical engine programs were fully resourced to maximize our return on investment, we are diluting resources by doing too much too soon. The planning was not well thought out."

item.author: No author info
item.description: "What is IT managements vision of the future of our IS. How should company be shaping itself to align with your goals.As company engineering becomes one IPD group, what is the plan for others?What is the visions for companys Manufacturing ERP system, is it a global solution?What is the vision for companys PLM system? Product design is moving towards Teamcenter Development is moving towards custom home grown software Manufacturing is moving towards Dassault SystemesWhat is the vision for document storage? Are we moving away from storing things on the I Drive and into sharepoint?What is the vision for work flows Custom home grown software? Sharepoint?"

item.title: "Again, I am an AME employee, based in Melrose Park. I called an IT employee in ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Again, I am an AME employee, based in Melrose Park. I called an IT employee in Indianapolis (AME headquarters) to ask to have AutoCAD 2010 installed. He said, ""I don't service Melrose Park, you need to put in a ticket. So I put in a ticket. The Melrose Park IT person told me that AutoCAD 2010 was not an option available to me, so he attempted to install AutoCAD 2007. The installation failed, so he had to reimage my computer. Upon setting up all of my unique software and settings I had AutoCAD 2007. The first drawing that a collegue sent me was based in AutoCAD 2010 so I couldn't open it. I called back to the Melrose Park IT person and he said that I needed to call Indianapolis IT. AFTER TWO WEEKS OF HEADACHE I CALLED THE SAME GUY THAT I CALLED IN THE FIRST PLACE. He said, ""Oh, I guess I can send you the link. 60 seconds later I had a link and 3 hours later the install was done and I had a functioning version of AutoCAD 2010. I am just trying to get my job done and IT is more concerned about following their own obstructive procedures than helping me be productive."

item.title: "In the past, I could walk down the hall and ask our local IT person. Now, ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "In the past, I could walk down the hall and ask our local IT person. Now, I have to call and get someone who does not have a command of the english language and struggle through issues. This takes time and there are times I will ask our local comp. wiz for assistance rather than fire up the overseas network (My opinion). Not only that we now share someone with coorporate who is not always here. However this person is very responsive to my needs and my hats off to him. I greatly appriciate the local contract IT individual as well."

item.title: "IT is difficult to do business with. A good share of my job and others in ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT is difficult to do business with. A good share of my job and others in my area is helping to navigate these waters beause of this.* Planview is not user friendly, difficult, and confusing. The only portion that's clear is the charges that come back to us--that proces works well.* The ""reconfigured"" Help Desk does not add significant value. I frequently know and understand individuals who resolve issues IT, and then fix my issue before the ticket is even routed to them.* The ""core technology"" areas (database, server, etc.) seem to be almost unresponsive to the other members of IT. They seem to have no accountability or sharing in resovling the issues--again just care about ""working the ticket"".* For new initiatives, finding individuals who can help outside of our core support teams is difficult. * IT seems understaffed in the areas of SharePoint, document management services, web design, web programming, and database analysts. We cannot continue to rely on outside firms to help with these key technologies.* A prevailing notion seems to be that project execution is owned by IT. The business should drive project execution."

item.title: "It is difficult to have issues resolved quickly when calling the hotline, since they seem to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "It is difficult to have issues resolved quickly when calling the hotline, since they seem to just take down information and forward it along as a ticket number. It would be nice to be able to speak to someone who can actually help. A walk-up help desk would be the most helpful."

item.description: "IT outsourcing has created many problems. Disconnected ""owners"", Products with bad interfaces (Maximo), time delays, lack of knowledge, lack of concern for (company) projects/profits and Language issues as well as other across the globe communications problems, IT is much harder to work with and is less efficient."

item.title: "IT personnel should communicate more frequently with their customers. I had put in a request to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT personnel should communicate more frequently with their customers. I had put in a request to replace my desktop with my laptop and several of my emails requesting a status update went unanswered. I understand that there will be periodic delays with processing requests and responding to emails, but I still expect some sort of response containing status updates and explanations on the reasons for delays. Without a response, I don't even know if anyone from IT is working on the issue. I am a firm believer any businness entity should be proactive in discussing customer wants and needs, and that two-way dialogues are will enablers to delivering the best possible solutions. "

item.title: "Planview is ""Pain View"". There is limited visibility to where requests are in the queue or ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Planview is ""Pain View"". There is limited visibility to where requests are in the queue or expected target date for getting anything. The use of too many tools: 1)Maximo for help desk/fix it, 2) Planview for enhancements, 3) Phire for configuration/migrations...why so many tracking tools? Business Partners don't look at the business at an enterprise level and are always looking to add to the portfolio of systems rather than reduce it. Too much talking out of both sides of the mouth (no SAP! ...Waukesha/Indy going to SAP!) IT is being outsourced and the employees that are left that know anything are being stretched very thin. "

item.title: "Really depends on the individual, not on widespread process or capability within IT. Some people are ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Really depends on the individual, not on widespread process or capability within IT. Some people are very easy to do business with. Others less so. PMs vary by how well they project manage and keep status communicated. Not very many PMs are good at note taking, summarizing status of meetings, etc. but they do a good job getting things set-up in planview appropriately and getting stuff taken to governance. business analysts vary by experience. some are better than others, many are more systems analyst and communicate current system constraints that what could be / is technologically feasible. "

item.title: "Recently I had a new contractor who needed access to Tolas. Later I was told to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Recently I had a new contractor who needed access to Tolas. Later I was told to order Reflection for this person in order to get access to Tolas, delaying his ability to be productive. Why isn't this tied together into one easy, user-friendly process? If 2 items are inter-related, they should already be linked in the process. Or at least an automatic email response saying something else needs to be done?"

item.title: The biggest frustration is having to open a ticket with the help desk and sometimes getting ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The biggest frustration is having to open a ticket with the help desk and sometimes getting notification that instead an incident has replaced the service request and subsequently sometimes the incident has been replaced with a problem request. It is difficult to tie them together. IT does not do it for us. it is the job of the person who creates the ticket to make sure it does not get lost or farmed out to the wrong organization within company regardless of how specific you are with your request.

item.title: "The Help Desk has not been a good experience on a few levels. I submitted a ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The Help Desk has not been a good experience on a few levels. I submitted a ticket in the last few months regarding an ODBC driver. The Help Desk person asked me to spell it and then got it wrong on the email follow-up. It would be wonderful if they had a bit more knowledge and were able to solve issues. We were told by the local IT person that was dispatched that they aren't supposed to do anything other than take information and do minimal tasks like resetting passwords.Given all the multitude of systems the various departments use, there is no way for a Help Desk person who doesn't even work for us to understand our problem. We need local business unit IT people that can be quickly deployed and are familiar with a particular business group. However, I know in our area that many, many of those people were cut in the last couple years."

item.title: "The person responsible for our Oracle/Stellant issues is not always cooperative. He is impatient and instead ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The person responsible for our Oracle/Stellant issues is not always cooperative. He is impatient and instead of helping to resolve problems he creates more.The language barrier for our outsourced help is frustrating. It also slows down the process of getting issues resolved. Often times they mark issues as resolved because they don't understand. When screen shots and explanations of problems are sent and they have to pass on the problem to another support person they do not forward the entire e-mail so the new support person has to ask all the questions and get all the screen shots again. This is time consuming for all. "

item.title: "The response time when calling/emailing the IT Sevice Desk is rather long, sometimes over 72 hours. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The response time when calling/emailing the IT Sevice Desk is rather long, sometimes over 72 hours. When you do reach someone, they do not seem to understand our systems, software, IT structure, etc. This makes both parties involved very frustrated. Often times tickets are not resolved timely and accurately, resulting in more tickets being created as they say it isn't related to the original ticket. Once the ticket is escalated to company IT, the response time is quick and is resolved accurately the first time."

item.title: "Absolutity not. The service desk is a multifacited enity within itself. I submit work orders to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Absolutity not. The service desk is a multifacited enity within itself. I submit work orders to a individual that doesn't usually understand. I may be told I have to complete a form which I know I don't or I am assured the request will be filed within 4 hours. Filed does not mean corrected or even started. That my take up to 4-5 days. If we have a question about our SR there is no one that we can talk to for an answer. We are not notified if & when our problem is corrected. However I have been questioned 2 months later if specific SR's have been completed because evidentally you don't know. There is no one we can contact or talk to that will respond or look into items. You are a nameless, faceless orginzation."

item.title: "As a new hire, there were numerous programs not installed, and getting them were very time ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "As a new hire, there were numerous programs not installed, and getting them were very time consuming and inefficient. When the person on the other end of the phone doesn't know the word ""adobe"" and it is supposed to be an IT service desk, there is a bit of a problem. The operators should at least have a little bit of knowledge so they are requesting the correct item in the ticket, especially since I would assume it is a service the IT team pays for. Additionally, all of the documents, etc. that need to be approved by my manager for each item was an inconvenience. My coworker and I both replaced previous positions; we were not a created position. It seems that our computers and accessibility could have been mirrored from the employees prior to us permissions, for everything from SharePoint to company Connect to Web site accesses. "

item.title: "As mentioned, I haven't had a good experience with the helpdesk in a very long time. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "As mentioned, I haven't had a good experience with the helpdesk in a very long time. In one instance, I was trying to explain my problem and the man I was speaking with was degrading at best. He was impatient and wouldn't listen to me. He made me very upset. Another instance I remember is calling and completely not understanding a word this person said. I asked to speak with someone else but that didn't happen. I finally convinced them to have someone here help me. Then I decided to try the web chat where you can type your question. That wasn't any better. Just this morning I was having difficulty just logging on. I shut down my computer 3 times, lost almost an hour of productivity, but would NOT call the helpdesk. It is a big inconvenience dealing them. 9 times out 0f 10 you need someone here anyway. So I call India or wherever, then I can't effectively communicate with them because of the language barrier, so they call someone here to help me. Where does that make any sense? Others feel the same way, believe me. I really hope they all express their feelings here like I am because it is a completely ineffective, non-value added way of doing business. We may be saving dollars by using an alternative to a U.S based company on paper. If going to another country saves money, you need to make sure there is not this language barrier. It's totally frustrating! I think company really needs to re-evaluate this process or the company we are using because in my opinion someone needs to ask the question of how much productivity is being lost because of how bad this situation is. I haven't heard one single positive experience with our helpdesk."

item.title: "I am a contract employee with an old loaner laptop (Dell D610) that completely crashed on ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am a contract employee with an old loaner laptop (Dell D610) that completely crashed on the first day. Since repaired, I find it impossible to maintain connectivity or access due to anti-virus software that won't load, barriers to access normal Parts regions and difficulty resolving problems with Help Desk. I have resorted to using my own personal laptop to access e-mail through Web only. I have low expectations because I understand the limitations that large companies face but even so, I have been very disappointed."

They have a hard time determining what my needs are, and communicating with them is very difficult. They usually have to redirect my issue, as they have no idea how to resolve it. I find the outsourced people are NOT helpful at all and I spend way too much time on the phone with them trying to help them instead of them helping me. Our internal help desk is wonderful! I would like to be directly connected to them for all issues. They resolve issues easily and correctly. "

item.author: No author info
item.description: "I have used the help desk 6-7 times. When it is during the business day, the assistance has been outstanding, even when I spoke with someone in India. However I had an emergency at 8:30 PM - all of my files disappeared and I was finalizing a proposal that was due to the customer the following morning. All the help desk was able to do was input an issue ticket. I wasn't contacted about that work ticket until the next afternoon. Luckily when I got into the office and logged on via the docking station, all of my files were accessable. It was a couple days later that I was contacted about having my files restored. With our electronic world, we cannot wait three days to restore files!"

Finally, IT ""lost"" one of my tickets in the past 12 months, never assigned it to anyone, and never worked on it. I had to call back twice to get work started on it."

item.title: "I've have to contact the help desk a lot over that past year. Sometimes it very ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I've have to contact the help desk a lot over that past year. Sometimes it very hard to understand what the person is saying. Example - A week ago Monday I called the help desk to see if there were problems with the external website. I had to give my user-id about 9 times and the person still got it wrong. I gave A as in Apple, B as in Basket, C as in Cat and they still could not get it. I asked the person if they could let me know if there was an issue with the external website and I could not get an answer until they got my user-id right. The call was about 10 minutes long and I was finally told there was a problem with the site I was trying to get. My user-id was not needed to answer the question. This is just one example."

item.title: "Last week, I requested that an intern obtain access to three things: a shared drive, access ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Last week, I requested that an intern obtain access to three things: a shared drive, access to our website, and ability to scan documents on a printer on our floor. He was given access to the shared drive in a prompt manner and I received confirmation. However, regarding the website, I received confirmation that he was set up properly, but he was not set up because he couldn't log in--he eventually received access, but it was an extra couple days later. In addition, no confirmation email was sent letting us know he was properly set up after the follow-up request. The only reason we knew he was set up properly is because he successfully tried to log in. As for him being able to scan on the local printer, it appears as though someone tried setting him up, but it was not set up properly. Apparently someone is still working on this, and it has been a week later. In addition to this employee, I requested that a National Account Manager receive access to our website on 5/9/2011 but I never received confirmation from anyone and once again it wasn't until the user was able to log in that we found out he did have access. "

item.title: "Months ago I had issue at the local level; it took the answering services quite a ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Months ago I had issue at the local level; it took the answering services quite a while to have a real person address my needs, which were very simple. Somehow the org. changed and it was not very responsive even though I am sure all of the boxes got checked to say everyone did a good job. It used to be that we could take an issue to a local real person and have the issue addressed right now. Now it goes into essentially into a black hole...which is good foe the IT dept. as they can show how many resources were saved...I ended up solving my own problems after much struggle...but the ""new"" process worked...resources of the IT dept. were saved!!!! and they were credited!! Just like the rest of the business world...push your work on someone else....anyone. The MBA boys s/b proud. "

item.title: "Stop with the not my job responses. It doesnt matter if IT doesnt control the budget. ...

item.description: "Stop with the not my job responses. It doesnt matter if IT doesnt control the budget. Close the ticket only after the department management, the group who makes that decision, has communicated it to the ticket writer."

item.title: "The help desk in India answers quickly, is very freindly and sometimes can solve my problem. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The help desk in India answers quickly, is very freindly and sometimes can solve my problem. More often a ticket is referred to IT and I wait for days for a call. When my computer crashed while travelling earlier this month it took 3 calls to the help desk over 6 days before IT responded. They are good when they call back but the wait is unacceptable. Blackberry is the only means of survival."

item.title: "The Help Desk personnel act more as secretaries, but do not take proper notes when creating ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The Help Desk personnel act more as secretaries, but do not take proper notes when creating a ticket. They ask a lot of questions and do not put down the responses on the ticket. I find that I have to repeat the same responses at least two or three times for every ticket if it is not a simple issue, and then repeat it yet again when the on-site IT person contacts me. This is even more so an issue when using the IT Chat function. The IT Help person on the chat should copy the conversation and attach it to the ticket to prevent the conversation from being wasted time.This would be a more functional business practice for IT.Also, I have noticed an increasing communication barrier when calling the Help Desk, but it is not on my end. I can understand them even with heavy accents, but most do not seem to be able to do the same or do not understand a lot of the IT issues and concepts. This adds three to five minutes to any conversation when the person does not readily understand and has I have to repeat the issue several times before it seems to click. I am not sure if this is a language barrier issue or a call center lack of industry knowledge, but it takes time away from my projects. "

I often feel that they do not understand the problem, they only write the problem down and pass it on."

item.title: "The IT Service Desk has lacked some responsiveness, constantly assigned tickets incorrectly (even when specifying the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT Service Desk has lacked some responsiveness, constantly assigned tickets incorrectly (even when specifying the correct group when opening the ticket), or simply ignored tickets. The internal solution is to simply avoid the Service Desk and go directly to the group to get the work done and then open a ticket at the same time. At this point in time this is the most effecient route unfortunately."

item.title: "The IT service desk is a terrible experience. You cannot understand them and they cannot understand ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT service desk is a terrible experience. You cannot understand them and they cannot understand me. They consistantly do the wrong thing when asking them for help, if they help you. Seems like they just create tickets for the IT employee's in the company to do the work. Once the IT department has received the ticket (can be hours or days) the ticket is worked on and usually taken care of in a timely manner. Why would company put a block in place of going directly to the IT department you know will fix the issue? It's time consuming and very frustrating on my part. My co workers also say the IT service desk is a joke. A huge joke on company. Who approved this change and why does it continue to be this way? Open your eyes management."

item.title: "It is understandable that to cut costs, jobs are shipped overseas for pennies on the dollar. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "It is understandable that to cut costs, jobs are shipped overseas for pennies on the dollar. With that, quality has decreased as we tend to get what we pay for and that is understandable. The problem comes in with speaking with people on the other end who simply could care less, they have no drive or interest in what they are doing. Server Admins who suggest ""adding space"" to servers which will not solve any problems, DBA's who simply ignore requests (until Sev 2 is opened), and tickets which are emailed and documented...but are never acknowledged or opened."

item.description: "Yes, overall I am ok with the final results when I do report an issue. However, usually when I call the help desk, they end up referring my ticket back to someone locally, so I don't really understand why we have to first call India (it is difficult to understand the techs who answer calls from India) to get someone here at WHQ to help us. That seems counterproductive as well as annoying. I believe these jobs should remain in the U.S."

item.title: "You are just trying to hire the lowest priced people from India that you can find. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "You are just trying to hire the lowest priced people from India that you can find. You are not Patriotic to the United States and are only interested in your own selfish bottom line. You want to make money off of the USA without a commitment to keeping its people employed. When IBM hires workers to work within here at our facility the USA to do IT work, all too often it hires foreigners to do it. Your outsourcing work is not appriciated. Indians located in India and New Delhi are hard to understand and at the end of many calls the answer is either ""You will have to reboot"" which I could have done myself in a half hour's less time, or ""I will write a ticket so your local IT person can stop by to help."" Pathetic."

item.title: "Almost all issues are solved by local IT people, yet we still have to call the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Almost all issues are solved by local IT people, yet we still have to call the hotline. The hotline people rarely understand the issue and are little more than receptionists for the local IT group. I will say that the local IT group are adept for the most part, but seem understaffed as response time is lacking.Another major issue I have is the poor access to software tools. Other companies I have worked for have a website where employees can search a list of available software then simply click on the tool they need and the software will automatically install. If the software is restricted, the website will automatically bring up an approval form which will be emailed to the appropriate parties for approval. Once approval is given, simply go back to the website and download the software. This system is so simple and efficient, and no human IT employee has to touch a computer for software install (other than troubleshooting). When I first started here, I had to wait two weeks for two items of software that are necessary for my job. And I'm not near the only individual that has had this issue."

item.title: "Although the on site IT staff generally does a good job, it takes a long time ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Although the on site IT staff generally does a good job, it takes a long time for them to respond. The people that take ticket information over the phone generally don't know what to write in the ticket even when I try to get them to write it word for word. In the past year, I've had more printer and service outages than anywhere I've ever been."

item.title: "Although there are some wonderful, helpful people in the IT organization, it seems that overall, anything ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Although there are some wonderful, helpful people in the IT organization, it seems that overall, anything that has been done to ""improve"" the organization has made things more difficult all around. Finding how to access a program, a site, a software, is the most painful of processes. There is guidance to only the highest level of needs, and then extremely little. As a whole, it seems IT is made up of unnecessary people hanging on with no value, people who don't know what they're doing, and a few really great, helpful, knowledgeable people."

item.title: As a relatively new employee (6 months) my experience has been that using other people's personal ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: As a relatively new employee (6 months) my experience has been that using other people's personal contacts is by far the most effective way of getting any focussed support. I received no helpful support from IT in terms of company IT processes and policies. In particular I am amazed that I have never been given any instruction or training relating to data security and backups which considering how much company confidential and proprietary data is available on individual's laptops is a major weakness. I did order a local back up drive when I originally ordered my laptop but to date (6 months later) there has been no sign of it or follow up.

This is extremely lacking. I feel completely disconnected with IT and I'm not sure if it will ever be better."

item.title: "As I noted, calling the service desk for issues creates an inconvenience. Many IT team members ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "As I noted, calling the service desk for issues creates an inconvenience. Many IT team members would rather email back and forth several times then come to the desk or call and work it out. I understand that some issues may be solved easily by logging on remotely, but some would be quicker to just be more willing to come to the desk. That being said, I had a major issue with Adobe, and Ed Durham, in particular, was EXTREMELY helpful. He has checked up on me for issues every once in a while ever since. It helps having someone I know I can go to. He is a great person for your team! Also, there seems to be a bit of a gap if people do resolve an open issue, and when it gets closed. Sometimes it gets done, and I get contacted later with someone thinking its open, and sometimes it gets closed before it is resolved. I am guessing it would help internally with checking efficiency if this was monitored more closely. I think Lisle would be an easier move if the IT team makes sure to be open to temporarily move away from the 'ticket' way of solving issues. People are already cranky about the move, so the fewer things to give them to complain about, the better. "

item.title: "From what has been stated from those in IT about ACHIEVE, there is strong cause for ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "From what has been stated from those in IT about ACHIEVE, there is strong cause for concern. The individuals in IT are very concerned about their jobs go forward. The group seems demoralized by all of the changes that have occured over the past two years which all have been perceived as negative to the group and it's customers (re-badging, Planview, IT Help Desk) and ACHIEVE introduces yet another change.Furthermore, from what I understand on the ACHIEVE model (support organization vs. project-based), it will create a ""have"" and ""have not"" environment. The support area suffers because it does not learn new skills and work on interesting projects and is paid less, and deals with disgruntled customers; the project-based area gets all the focus and more pay and happier customers. If the support group is to be outsourced, no one internally is happy with the service levels from outsourced organizations becuase they are not in contact with us or share accountability for our goals. Outsourcing almost always never works because it takes 2x-3x longer for them to accomplish the work. I have personally seen this model implemented in two companies, with the results being not good, and the one causing another complete restructure 5 years later.IT seems to be moving towards a ticket-based, metrics-based environment and true ignoring customer service, which seems to being only be futhered by ACHIEVE. This is a bit contrary to the relationship-based values of company. True customer service will not show up in ticket counts. We also need to employ individuals locally within our company rather than rely on outside firms to help us. We know our business best--not consulting firms, and certainly not outsource providers. Our interactions with these firms has been very costly with very mixed results and have proven to be very costly."

item.title: "Help desk has become laughable. The individuals who respond don't even seem to know about the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Help desk has become laughable. The individuals who respond don't even seem to know about the systems that have failed. I get survey requests asking to respond to HelpDesk performance even before the issue is resolved. Enterprise Data Warehouse, Feature Search, Workflow, etc crash or go down - error messages are sent to Help Desk and days / weeks later I get a phone call asking for what the issue is. Thankfully, someone already fixed the problem or the server came back on line, but the ""front line"" people clearly don't know our systems or their performance status. "

The off-shore resource says it is entered as production critical but the local rep says it didn't show up in their queue until late in the day or many hours later.

item.title: "I am disappointed with Middle Managment and the way it views and treats the workers (assets)of ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am disappointed with Middle Managment and the way it views and treats the workers (assets)of the organization; I thought our core values included more than just ""Customer Focus"". Where is the ""Communication"", ""Accountabilty"", ""Respect for People"", ""Speed Simplicity Agility"", ""Innovation"", & ""Relentless Pursuit of Quality in ALL we do""?I see hints of the values in the EC but it is not reflected by ALL of the Middle Managers or Team Leads, yet they remain in the status quo and continue to lead to the disengagment of good employees who are to burnt out to care any longer, and treated like troublemakers for pointing out any issues. And since this is negative I can only expect it to be dismissed as an unimportant complaint. Given the appropriate forum (without fear of retribution) others would most likely agree as this is based upon what I have heard as well as ""felt"" myself."

item.title: I am not satisified with the service provided by the help desk. The business partner that ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I am not satisified with the service provided by the help desk. The business partner that assists my department is great and I enjoy working with her and she is proactive in trying to meet my needs.

item.title: "I am not sure why this survey was written this way. 'IT,' is a moniker that ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am not sure why this survey was written this way. 'IT,' is a moniker that can suggest different things to different people.I have found certain people within the Local IT Help Desk organization to be very easy to deal with, willing to provide assistance and very flexible. Getting to them via India has been a less than desireable experience.In terms of IT providing hardware, I find we are using adequately good material. It's not the best or fastest, but it works.In terms of IT providing basic software (OS, Office, Hypersnap, UG, etc...) It works, however its 2011 and we are still using office 2007. In terms of IT providing specific, non-enterprise level software/database solutions, IT has fallen flat. There seems to be no mechanism (or desire) to help small groups with their needs. I can provide specific examples, should the need arise to contact me.In general, IT may be doing an excellent job at a very high level. We can take a truck order, convert it to POs to suppliers, route parts across the globe, build vehicles, back flush material, invoice dealers, etc... but we can't provide a decent project management tool to track quality issues, or we cannot provide a system that ties all Workflow business applications (pixys, PCBL, APCN, Release, WA, etc..) together automatically. "

item.description: "I am very engaged in the PROS project and believe the team is providing tremendous support. As a new employee, all issues raised to the help desk have been resolved adequately and timely and exceeds other organization benchmarks."

item.title: "I am worried that the model of sending IT support off-shore frightens me. It is extremely ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I am worried that the model of sending IT support off-shore frightens me. It is extremely valuable having someone on site that we can build a relationship with, that knows our systems, and can suggest improvements.I'd also like IT to push for one source of all people data. There are way too many people data systems that don't talk to each other. For example, Data Security has their own system and the Melrose system doesn't talk to the WHQ system, so a Melrose employee has to be given a visitor badge when at WHQ (I would think an employee is an employee). I think it would be better if all people (employees, contractors, consultants, POI, etc.) should be in PeopleSoft and that system should feed every other system."

item.title: "I believe read-only access to the BaaN database should be improved. There is so much important ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I believe read-only access to the BaaN database should be improved. There is so much important information in the db that we could be using to push our plant forward. I do not like that all inquiries must be interactive. I do not like the cryptic tedious manner in which Baan builds the query. eProcure is great! Most of our local pc and network techs are top-notch! The new Outlook configuration is great! The STDDT is great! Long term issues: Network is many times slow and logging on is always too slow. "

item.title: "I don't think IT will ever get a superior rating because today's technology changes too fast ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I don't think IT will ever get a superior rating because today's technology changes too fast and transistions to new processes are always difficult. Also, ridiculous budget restrictions on enhancements to existing systems force the business to do constant work-arounds to manage everything while new systems are being designed. Our IT organization cannot keep up with all of the needs of our expanding business initiatives. The push to grow the company to a $20 billion Company is forcing new ways of doing business, to which IT could not possibly respond in the time frame needed. I'm glad I am not a member of the IT group. "

I have been in Fort Wayne the entire time until recently relocating to the Sara Lee building.I am available to discuss any of these issues."

item.title: "I feel that outsourcing our IT Dept. is one of the biggest mistakes this company has ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I feel that outsourcing our IT Dept. is one of the biggest mistakes this company has made. It may be cost effective from the company's standpoint but it is not people effective from my standpoint or for my department. When something is not done correctly we have to keep putting tickets in to have someone come over and resolve our issues. Also,it is very clear that the plant has priority over our location. It sometimes takes several days for someone to come over and give us the help we need. To me that is not acceptable. In my opinion Parts should have its own IT department with people from this company that understands our processes and not some outside company."

item.title: I feel that tech support is slow to respond and usually unclear about how to proceed. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I feel that tech support is slow to respond and usually unclear about how to proceed. The procurement process is ridiculously long and provides no guidance on what items should be ordered for new employees.

item.title: I feel that the current IT department is slow and does not anticipate the needs of ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I feel that the current IT department is slow and does not anticipate the needs of the business. We should not have to call around the world to get local assistance. A lot of cases there are simple things like printer toner and ink cartridges that we have to wait weeks on end for. The process for getting new software installed is ridiculously long and I feel it does not contribute well to the needs of the business.

item.title: I find it ironic that when you dial 6666 and it asked you to select 1 ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I find it ironic that when you dial 6666 and it asked you to select 1 for english and the person you get on the phone to help you can only speak broken english at it best. The group in Inday (I guess) is only helpful about 50% of the time the other they have to kick it to someone else (local team). That brings on another issue. Ever since the local team was made IBM employees that have had a worse attitude than when they were company employees (and it was not great then). All they try and do now is shuck responsibility. Every time you go to them now you hear a 30 minute speach on how they are not company employees blah blah blah. The corporate IT made this change and did not even look at what each plants IT team did. Then they changed the on site employee to IBM and now they can't do all of what they were doing before. Who is suppose to take over thier responsibilities now. Everyone in this plant has plenty of responsibility right now and you have an outside vendor (IBM) trying to give you more work. I am not pleased with this.

item.title: I have had a few instances of dealing with IT. Some of the simple things such ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I have had a few instances of dealing with IT. Some of the simple things such as setting up my printer or password changes etc... have been dealt with wonderfully. But I had a very important instance where the program I work in for my department had a failure and it took IT a very long time to correct it. In fact others in my department helped me fix the problem because IT was taking so long to get back with me. They seemed very unorganized and I believe the main reason for this was the possible overseas or seperate locations of the people I was dealing with. It seemed like no one wanted to take the initiative to help fix the problem which in tern was a very simple solution for them to do. I work in the warranty department and process claims.Tens if not hundreds of thousands of dollars pass through my terminal weekely and I was down for about 4 days. Also because I am required to have my name signature on everything I do through my login it was impossible for me to work on someone elses computer. My managers also tried as hard as they could to speed up the process but were also met with resistance. I thought this was an important topic to be made aware of because of the time and money lost do to the IT personel I was dealing with. I believe it would have been fixed within hours if I had simply been put on a priority list to be handled ASAP. I hope this may help in your survey and future choices. Thank you

Either I'm out in left field, or no one really cares."

item.title: "I have only one comment in our IT direction:The decision to move Uptime Parts QAD environment ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I have only one comment in our IT direction:The decision to move Uptime Parts QAD environment to be hosted externally at a QADvendor location was very confusing and frustrating. The technical and business case that was presented did not seem to be the best solution. I provided alterative solutions that would leverage existing infrastructure and consolidate Workhorse & Uptime Parts QAD environments. However, my proposal was not reviewed thoroughly by any of the teams to evaluate if this proposal was any cost saving for company. From the responses I received, it appeared that the decision to outsource had been made before the proposals were put together. Outsourcing the QAD application was quoted as 1 Million dollars, which is a biginvestment in an environment that is not strategic (long term). Even more concerning is that we would not own the QAD/Infrastructure with this deal, and I believe that when the time comesto finally migrate QAD to a replacement platform, we will again need to pay to the external vendors. The proposal I have provided would have saved infrastructure cost for both the business units and the QAD maintenance & licensing cost by half. This was very disappointing that no one was able to see this cost justification. OR at least, no one explained to me in a logical way why my proposal did not make the most sense."

item.title: I have refrained from calling the help desk because most of the time I end up ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: I have refrained from calling the help desk because most of the time I end up talking to people with accents and I cant understand them and sometimes they don't understand what I am in need of so I just deal with what I have to work with on my computer and live with it. It's too much of a hassle to try to explain my problem to someone that has no knowledge of the systems I use as to what my issue is.

item.title: "I have to say that I am very reluctant in calling the IT Service desk because ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I have to say that I am very reluctant in calling the IT Service desk because my confidence level is low. I'd rather speak with someone local.I just recently began using the ""Chat Help - IT Service Desk"" feature on my laptop. I think this is great! I have only used it a couple of times, but it's a great feature. One negative comment: I had a chat on 6/14/11 with an IT Service Desk representative and the response I received was not great. The issue was resolved, but the representative did not give a good response - it could have been more professional. I saved the chat - if someone would like to review it, I am happy to forward the chat and discuss it as necessary."

item.title: "I hope that you will not abandon Fort Wayne altogether but utilize your resources here for ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I hope that you will not abandon Fort Wayne altogether but utilize your resources here for the amelioration of this great company. The work force here cannot be matched in their innovations, colaboration, and service to both this great company and this community. They are truly your greatest asset. I can see many uses for this facility as a testing ground for truck assemblys and military builds and as a central hub for supplies."

item.title: "I think IT does a great job given the cards it is handed. Thigns we (Business ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I think IT does a great job given the cards it is handed. Thigns we (Business + IT) can do better:Prioritize and budget IT initiatives. I am now seeing evidence of a more disciplined approach of IT project portfolio management.Business support! There are two areas where we need improvement. The business providning SME's to launch a project as well as business resources to support an application and process after it has launched. Too many times we launch an application, htere are no admin/support/training support resrouces in place to manage the process and ensure the data is credible. Without this support we either do not use software to its potential, or the dtaa in our systems is not credible.I appreciate the strategic efforts of Tom Hupp and Frank Dudley in driving for more Enterprise applications like Teamcenter."

Before we could get fairly immediate response to issues. We do not feel the company cares about our issues, but it is more about saving money and salaries."

I still don't see IT as a business partner. I view the group as more reactive than proactive. Areas where I think more attention is needed are reporting and compliance.

"

item.title: "I understand having all requests routed through the IT Sevice Desk is for efficiency. However, it ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "I understand having all requests routed through the IT Sevice Desk is for efficiency. However, it does not feel efficient for the customer. The response time is too long. Once I get to the IT person who can help me, I have found the service to be great. There have been system issues to deal with that could not be resolved timely but I know IT has taken steps to improve the response time in the future. I also worked with IT members on system enhancements. I found them knowledgeable and helpful. It has been a tough year working through the system issues but I do see progress and feel that overall IT does a good job."

item.title: "If you have only worked at company, you do not have a concept as to how ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "If you have only worked at company, you do not have a concept as to how bad things really are here. company is at least 10 years behind with PD processes that fully leverage PLM tools. IT and PLM infrastructure is painfully slow and does not seem to be what the vendor (Siemens) recommends or supports. FORD and GM have way more simultanious users of Teamcenter, they utilize it's capabilities much better and it works great. NOT HERE. Very frustrating. And, Sea Change does not have a clue how to achieve this either. IT support can be a major Black Hole. NO enforced service-level-agreement on response. Unacceptable at other compaines. Be careful when the ""competition"" figures out how to do basic IT/PLM. "

item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT continues to reduce it's presence througout the manufacturing plants. Leaving behind only IBM employees who longer have a sense of urgency. I have to call India to get a person in the same facility to come address a problem. Centralizing people in the new glass catherdal will look good, but I do not see how it will deliver value to our customers. Customers in this sense being internal. The only skills valued by IT leadership at this point are upper level executives who can make a budget look good. So the stock goes up and they and the shareholders make money. The skills of the employees that actually do the work are not valued because they cost too much so there skill are outsourced to low cost geography. it really is offensive. "

"

item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT realistically runs on the shoulders of the few people who have not been outsourced yet. In having conducted interviews for company, many of the IT managers themselves would not be able to pass basic technical questions which results ""disconnected"" people making important technical decisions. There is and has been a need to change IT, no question about that. In the immediate quest to save money (and at the end of the day its all about the money), part of the soul of IT has been lost. We can produce as many charts or graphs as we like or move folks around or shift to outside vendors, however the most important thing that can't be done is to get someone who works for another company to care."

item.title: "IT should offer a training session for New Managers. This training session should include: 1. Overview ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "IT should offer a training session for New Managers. This training session should include: 1. Overview and Responsibilities of the IT department 2. The process for on-boarding a new employee as it relates to IT 3. Review of the forms or websites were requests need to be submitted and more detailed info can be found. Also understanding when certain forms need to be used - i.e. EURs etc. Our new Manager was not aware of these until I had several discussions with the IT Help Desk to figure out the issues. If this type of training is already on the University website, Managers should be required to take the class when they first begin employment."

item.description: "It usually takes numerous attempts to get anything resolved. They are too worried about following the process than getting things done. Any real issue we have, because the person on the phone does not understand our systems, it is difficult to get them to write correctly what the problem is. Then I get emails saying it was completed and it never was. When you call back they want to start a new call. "

item.author: No author info
item.description: "It's hard to wait for service desk to put a ticket and wait another 4 hours to get job done when local IT group can fix in less than 1 hour time. Some of the issues are related to production and we had to put IT ticket to get job done instead of viceversa. Also manufacturing IT needs to e alligned with production group business requirement. It's too less people and support which is affecting the production and project priorities."

item.title: "It's not clear to me what company's IT strategy is for the current year or five ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "It's not clear to me what company's IT strategy is for the current year or five years out. It appears that IT reacts to individual business unit project demands, despite the overlaps and conflicts. Not always IT's fault, but there seems to be a lack of synchronization between IT obejectives and all the various business units. Integrated goals would be very helpful. "

item.title: IT's process for project scoping and planning is cumbersome and not flexible and discourages the business ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: IT's process for project scoping and planning is cumbersome and not flexible and discourages the business from seeking their help. The helpdesk process is slow and it takes a day to get a basic question answered that used to only take the amount of time it would take to walk to a person and ask.

item.author: No author info
item.description: "Just to add to #11, my coworkers and I dread when we have to call the hot line. We realize that everyone is trying to do the job well but it just isn't as good as having your help personnel local. This message has been conveyed many times to IT and they don't get it! They are looking at the bottom line at the dollars and not what is best for the business. Once again, I urge IT to bring this work in house - even if it is contract employees."

item.title: "Let me be clear that my issues with the 800# IT group is not due to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Let me be clear that my issues with the 800# IT group is not due to the fact that they are foreign as we are a diverse company and I can appreciate that. My disappointment is with the level of service and inability for them to correctly log tickets, to resolve the issue themselves, or for them to actually forward in a timely manner the ticket to someone who can contact me back in less than 24 hours. Each time there has been a survey like this I have provided specific examples of situations that I have encountered with the 800# IT group. The problems are not being resolved with them and the level of service has not improved at all. Others have told me they don't fill out these surveys because they feel the issues won't be addressed and they don't want to spend the extra time to report their specific experiences."

item.description: "Local IT groups seem very short staffed for the current large projects that require their focus. We use systems that reqire specialists who understand the programming, those folks are consumed on other projects. "

item.author: No author info
item.description: Local IT has been a saving grace. I work extensively with Craig Harmeyer and Aaron Alcantar and have been thoroughly impressed by there responsiveness and ability to solve my issues.

item.title: "Local IT people are very helpful, but it is difficult to get your ticket routed to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Local IT people are very helpful, but it is difficult to get your ticket routed to the correct person. The help desk was much better several years back when local people that understand the systems that we used answered the calls. Most of the time they could solve the issue right away while you are on the phone with them. That is no longer possible in most cases. "

item.description: "Local IT personnel is very proactive and helpful, the help Desk doesn't provide any assistnce, they always send the request to the local people, and it takes too long just to fill out the ticket."

item.title: "Make the form that the IT Service Desk fills out available online for employees to fill ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Make the form that the IT Service Desk fills out available online for employees to fill out with a drop down list of where to route the issue (including an ""unknown"" option). Have the form routed automatically based on the selection of the routing list and create a ticket number and automated email to the user reporting the issue. Route issues with the routing option ""unknown"" sent to a ""Service Desk"" to determine what group they should be routed to ot contact the user reporting the issue for more information."

What a double standard when you management speaks of excellence. "

item.title: "company has chosen to conduct much of its business through electronic communication. However, its IT department ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "company has chosen to conduct much of its business through electronic communication. However, its IT department is a very poor support service. It's service is not timely, very hard to access, confused and wholly inadequeate. If company intends to do business electronically, it needs to provide its employees much better technical support than it is providing today. An employee with an IT problem can wait days for assistence, and when it comes, most likely, the IT person does not understand the issue or solve the problem. We need an IT change immediately."

Procedures need to be documented and the location of the documentation should be posted prominently on Connect."

item.title: "Service has severely degraded since work was outsourced to IBM. The onsite support personnel who now ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Service has severely degraded since work was outsourced to IBM. The onsite support personnel who now service my group are overworked, unresponsive, and unknowledgeable about my group's computing needs. Issues take much too long to be resolved, resulting in siginifcant downtime and loss of productivity.My group has been required to develop our own software tools and processes because IT has been unable or unwilling to support our software needs. We have been waiting for almost a year for assistance in resolving issues running our custom software in NX6. "

item.title: "SharePoint:We have been directed to utilize SharePoint as the repository for all new product development programs. ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "SharePoint:We have been directed to utilize SharePoint as the repository for all new product development programs. This includes all working documents from every team member.SharePoint is not a good file mgt tool, and I think it is a mistake for employees to use it as such. I waste way too much time trying to manage files in SP, especially if I am working over VPN.I suggest that the IT group work with company organizations to help them understand the SP pros and cons. Right now we are mandated to manage our work in the wrong tool.Thank you"

item.title: Simple items like connecting to a database over the network are not being done in an ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: Simple items like connecting to a database over the network are not being done in an orderly fashion if at all. Software update are not happening quickly and seamlessly. It may to seem like setting up a computer to access the wireless intranet is such a big effort. This is just basic stuff that reqular 1st year college student do. Get it together.

item.title: "Since all request now go through IT Service Request, it now takes longer to get our ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Since all request now go through IT Service Request, it now takes longer to get our local issues resloved and our IBM badged person now spends more time completing the ticket logs. Before it was real easy to contact our local IT company employee with the issue and then they would fix it immediately. Now it takes at least a half hour or longer to get simple issues resolved. I understand the change and why it was made, but it just does not work well for our small operation when we have IT issues and need to close the books on time for CCO."

item.title: "Since IBM took over our IT services, there are many days we are completely unable to ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Since IBM took over our IT services, there are many days we are completely unable to perform our work due to network and system issues. There are many ongoing problems within Teamcenter that have no solution. These problems cause us to have to restart our computers sometimes several times a day. I view the current IT service as a hindrance to our productivity. We had none of these problems when all of our IT functions were performed in house by direct company employees."

item.description: "The amount of time it takes to get resolution started is the main problem that I see. Once someone has an understanding of what is needed to be done, it is relatively fast. I would prefer to contact someone locally rather than to try to speak another language with an operator who is obviously in another country and doesn't know our systems here at this building very well. "

item.title: "The help desk does not understand our systems that are utilized in the field, or has ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The help desk does not understand our systems that are utilized in the field, or has to look up troubleshooting proccedures on the web for assitance, I can do that. In the field we use NAVISTAR service tool software for our Diamond Logic Electrical System, and MaxxForce Engines Service Software. I understand that they are not the software experts, but when dealing with company portals or internet access IT has no clue in how to support this Gate Way System. These Gate Ways are set up when software is intially loaded. Connection issues occur with the company issued Laptop and the first thing IT would like to do is reload the software package. These company Software Service Tools have one time use passwords issued at the time of purchase. The software can only be loaded once on one Laptop. Agin no understanding of the business of selling or servicing company products, Trucks and Tractors. "

item.title: The Help Desk is often an ordeal. The customre service people are in India and have ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The Help Desk is often an ordeal. The customre service people are in India and have a list of 20 canned questions that you must go thru just to open a ticket. They arenot capable of trouble shooting or resolving the issues but you still have to spend 10-15 minutes with them so they can write a profile. Can we streamline the process? Many of the workers try hard but have thick accents and are hard to understand.

item.author: No author info
item.description: The help desk(1300) is lacking. I wish they would speak english. The group at truck that actually fixes the problem is great.

item.title: "The hooks required for getting software seems quite cumbersome. At ITT CS, you could search their ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The hooks required for getting software seems quite cumbersome. At ITT CS, you could search their website for SW availble. If you didn't have a licence you could just call IT and they would contact your supervisor about whether you can have a license or not. If approved, withing a couple of days you could load the SW. The user could load the SW versus having an IT person take time out to load SW."

item.description: The I and U drives are too slow to use so I keep all my files locally on my hard drive. company needs to invest in better servers.

item.title: "The IT employees that work at WHQ are always helpful in resolving issues. They understand the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT employees that work at WHQ are always helpful in resolving issues. They understand the problems and resolve them quickly and accurately. My only problems have been with calling the HelpDesk and working with overseas HelpDesk employees. They have never been able to help me with any issues and always just end up opening a ticket. At times, just having them understand the issue and opening the ticket was a lengthy and frustrating process. There have been several mistakes made in the writing up of tickets. "

item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT organization should have a sharepoint that would have the latest process, policies and procedures. This would allow everyone to understand who to call in order to get certain processes done. There is no communication on how things work in IT. "

item.description: "The IT PC PAM team is good at responding to questions, but their procedures need to be consistent. The IT Service/Help desk is a complete waste of time. If you are lucky enough to understand them they are useless except to open a service ticket."

item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT personnel here at Engine Group are very responsive. When contacting the IT helpdesk it is hit or miss, some customer service reps are very helpful and other's are not."

item.title: "The IT personnel that I have had to work with have provided superior service.In addition the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT personnel that I have had to work with have provided superior service.In addition the onsite IT personnel at TDTC have done an excellent job with all IT issues that I have had."

item.title: "The IT service desk expereince is generally poor. There seems to be a lot of time ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT service desk expereince is generally poor. There seems to be a lot of time wasted communicating with the service desk the issue. This tends to drive the majority of users from contacting the service desk and taking their issues directly to the local support personnel. Tickets seem to get routed incorrectly or not at all many times. The offshore EDI team is difficult to work with, although they have been knowledgable and helpful, their working hours are not aligned with the typical US first shift and there has been days wasted trying to communicate back and forth resolving issues becuase of the difference in working hours. The offshore server support for non ITAR servers is difficult to work with, doesn't seem to show any urgency to outages, and has been non-resonsive to service requests at times."

item.title: The IT Service Desk Just calls someone to help. Can't we just call that dept. ourselfs? ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The IT Service Desk Just calls someone to help. Can't we just call that dept. ourselfs? There is a big language barrier to over come.

item.title: "The IT Service Team are friendly, professional, knowledgable, courteous, and effective in a timely manner. I ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT Service Team are friendly, professional, knowledgable, courteous, and effective in a timely manner. I appreciate the new follow up system to confirm issues are resolved to customer's satisfaction. I am one very satisfied customer. Thank you."
