item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT support staff at MLP are wonderful people who do a grat job, buit I feel they are hampered by a bad system. I think most would appreciate a more personal experience with an IT tech. EUR process is somewhat helpful, albeit non-intuitive."

item.title: "The IT Team has exceptionally good people and they are most enjoyable to work with. They ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The IT Team has exceptionally good people and they are most enjoyable to work with. They are very supportive and want to do a great job. However, I get the impression old systems prevent us from implementing ideas and moving the business forward. For example, TOLAS stabilization has absorbed most resources and we are not allowed to focus on future opportunities as there is a fear that changing code in TOLAS will add more to system instability. IT is clearly critical to our success and needs to become an even stronger partner going forward."

item.title: "The network is ridiculously slow, it takes twice the time to do anything. The network intermittently ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The network is ridiculously slow, it takes twice the time to do anything. The network intermittently cuts off and requires restarting programs/computer. The local IT people were clueless when it came to setting up my new computer....sound not working, spaceball not working, multiple programs missing, missing drivers, & slow response time from them. They didnt know where my new computer was that was being delivered to me, I had to go hunt it down myself. They are a generally hard to deal with. Some of the people from IBM Helpdesk are hard to understand. One time, it took 90 minutes to get someone logged on to Online Helpdesk Chat. There were a couple of times when tickets were closed before or while the problem was being fixed. "

item.title: The only issue I have is with all of the surveys. I understand that surveys are ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The only issue I have is with all of the surveys. I understand that surveys are an integral part of the service business but I have been hit with a notification to fill out a survey about every other day.

item.title: The only real issue I have is finding someone that has access to Defense laptops outside ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: The only real issue I have is finding someone that has access to Defense laptops outside business hours because of the ITAR regulations.

item.title: "The only request I would have is that if IT is aware of a network issue ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "The only request I would have is that if IT is aware of a network issue that they let people know so we are not wondering why things are not operating normally on our computers / printers.Also, it would be nice to have a dedicated IT person/group to support each area - like one for finance, one for accounting, one for purchasing - so they could better understand the specific system and data needs for those areas, instead of users sending requests into an unknown pool. Personaliztion goes a long way towards customer satisifaction. If you already have something like that, I am not aware.Thanks for putting out this survey."

item.title: "This didn't used to be this way. A couple years ago, we actually knew our IT ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "This didn't used to be this way. A couple years ago, we actually knew our IT people. They were prompt, helpful, showed us tricks of the trade in order to make our work more productive, and in general were great. Now I have to deal with someone in a foreign country(which is fine) with an accent I cannot understand(which is not fine, but I guess it's my problem), listen to crying babies in the background(because they must work out of their homes), and in general get no resolution unless I keep after them for days.I GIVE UP!"

item.title: "This is the worst I.T. experience I've had wherever I've worked, mostly due to the fact ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "This is the worst I.T. experience I've had wherever I've worked, mostly due to the fact that they should never have oursourced such an important function as I.T. overseas. It is INCREDIBLY FRUSTRATING to the average user, when they have to go through the HelpDesk.Last year, I.T. hosted a discussion with admins at WHQ, and there were MANY questions. They promised to get back to admins with the answers, and - several months later - we STILL don't have the answers. Also...I gave one of the presenters my business cards and asked her to call me for some feedback & discussion - she said she would - and never even bothered to call. That was months ago. That is, frankly, unacceptable."

Turns out they can't and I have wasted even more valuable time. Or they will argue with me when I tell them exactly who the ticket needs to go to. I finally end up getting a ticket number and calling the person who knows our location's systems anyway."

Is this the responsibility of the IT department (to set up training for a particular system)?"

item.title: "Two issues with IT: Lack of understanding (person not understanding what I'm saying and me not ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Two issues with IT: Lack of understanding (person not understanding what I'm saying and me not understanding what the person is saying) when I'm patched through to India for help. Having to say ""pardon me"" over and over and over is somewhat embarrassing and time consuming and also the person not understanding my explanation of the problem is a real hindrance to solving my issue. Also, timing of receiving help is another problem. For example, someone in my group sent a job order to our network printer one morning and for some reason it wouldn't print and he was unable to delete the print job from his print queue. Becase of this, the printer wasn't printing anything anyone in my group sent to the printer. I sent an e-mail to the service desk late morning (instead of calling and wasting time trying to explain to someone in India) and of course was informed that it would take 4 hours or more to have someone get back to me to resolve the issue. Well, our group went without a printer the whole day and by the next day the problem resolved itself on its own before we ever got a response back from the service desk. Wished there was someone in IT we could call in the building who could just help us out quickly with a problem like this but understand that times have changed and people are not available for this type of help anymore. "

item.title: "We have great response from the Corporate IT group but the turn around time for jobs ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "We have great response from the Corporate IT group but the turn around time for jobs handled by the IBM team is extremely long. The IBM team has no concept of the clients needs and timeframe. Currently, we are upgrading a case management database which will have to reside on it's own server. We have been informed that it will take IBM 10-12 weeks to build the server. We, the client, just do not understand how it can take almost three months to do this. "

item.title: "We have so many systems that if you have an issue with one system, it could ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "We have so many systems that if you have an issue with one system, it could be because of another. If that's the case the IT people don't work together to get the issue resolved. To me the attitude is if it's not in there area, they don't handle it. I've been an employee with the company for 3 years and I transitioned from NFC to defense and my IT experience has been ridiculous. I have a U-id already but it seems as though IT doesn't know how to read an EUR. The contractors get access faster than I do and I'm the employee! You don't know who to talk to to get help which is so frustrating...""call the help desk"". I don't even know where the help desk is? Is it in this country? I've worked for other companies with better IT departments than what we have. "

item.description: "We need better / more responsive systems to help us reduce costs. Current system requires too much input, touching the same thing several times with limited ability to trace. "

item.title: "When calling the IT Help desk i can get rather impatient. If there are issues with ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When calling the IT Help desk i can get rather impatient. If there are issues with a system, I have to hear the announcement/problem before I can proceed to the options. Often, it appears that the technicians/engineers on the other end sound like they are talking rather slowly and verifying information before I can proceed to the concern I have. I haven't timed it, but waiting for the opportunity to voice your issue can take near a minute. A minute surely doesn't sound like a long time, but if you imagine sitting in silence for that time before you can speak. I simply am noticing these steps before I have a chance to share the reason for the call."

item.title: "When I call IT, I should get a non-accented American voice, so that I may be ...

item.description: "When I call IT, I should get a non-accented American voice, so that I may be able to understand it. Also, when requesting access to a system, I should be able to get access within a week from first requesting it. Not months as it has been. Issues need to be resolved quicker and smoother. "

item.title: "When I reach our IT department at Melrose Park, They are all over any problems you ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When I reach our IT department at Melrose Park, They are all over any problems you have."

item.title: "When IT is mentioned, I believe this to be company employed personnel and not accenture support ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When IT is mentioned, I believe this to be company employed personnel and not accenture support desk. Our whole world is spinning because of the whole ticket system. For example. I have to create a Svc Req which can only be a 3 or 4 priority. Then it may get cancelled and get replaced by an incident or eventually a change request. the process is long and drawn out and keeping track of them is not easy. no one provides any feedback unless you hound them and even that does not help becuase we are understaffed. too many cheifs and not enough indians. it takes an act of God to get anything done. communicating with people in a differnt country adds another whole dimension - sometimes like being in the twilight zone. If we speak english, then we should have people who are working on our issues who have good control over the english language. some of my issues have taken an extrodinarily long timne to complete because of the language barrier. I do not see any regression testing going on when changes are put in and sometimes it appears that things that have been fixed revert back to being broken after subsequent fixes are imiplemented. Also, there does not seem to be a real sense of urgency. "

item.title: "When placing calls to help desk, it can be very challenging to understand the person that ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When placing calls to help desk, it can be very challenging to understand the person that answers the phone. There seems to be a lot of bad connections when calling."

item.title: "When there is a singificant issue and the local IT folks are involved the work is ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When there is a singificant issue and the local IT folks are involved the work is normally done in a timely and efficient manner. However, cutting through the layer of telephone support to get to the local team is far to difficult. "

item.title: "When there was a chance I'd need a new laptop, I was told it would be ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When there was a chance I'd need a new laptop, I was told it would be 6-8 weeks to get one. How can a company the size of company be so poorly prepared? An employee cannot function 6-8 weeks without a computer. Luckily, IT was able to resolve my issue."

item.title: "When we call for help language barriers are sometimes an issue. When a problem is called ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "When we call for help language barriers are sometimes an issue. When a problem is called in that first group hands it off to another group while they pat themselves on the back and send you a survey asking how you liked their service. I did not like it because my problem was still not resolved. Example, I had a bad printer. Called it in to 1300. They said they would pass it onto the local team. Local team comes looks at it and says printer broken we are passing onto outside printer repair people. Printer repair say printer is broken not repairable. At this point I have talked to 3 groups each who has told me the printer is broken. I start getting surveys about the service. Well, I am not really happy with the service because I still could not print after dealing with 3 different groups. By the time it was all said and done I was at least a month without a printer. A couple days I could see but not a month. This is probably the worst case example I have so far but I would just add that very rarely do I have a positive experience when I call for IT help. I think IT is supposed to be a service organization but I really give the IT help process and results very low grades. I think it was better when you were dealing with someone locally from start to finish. There was a relationship between IT and the customer and the IT person had ownership of the issue. Now it is a pass the buck as fast as you can process."

item.title: When you call 1300 you get someone that does not speak english and you cannot understand ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: When you call 1300 you get someone that does not speak english and you cannot understand each other. I just try to get a ticket number and then check with the IT personnel at the facility to make sure it is right. Big waste of time.

item.title: "WHen you call you cannot understand them and basically need to get a ticket number then ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "WHen you call you cannot understand them and basically need to get a ticket number then go back to teh IT group to have it updated to reflect what youu actually need done. Waste of time and resources. We also need better computers to ug design work. Computers cannot handle the data and keep crashing. Also a waste of time and resources."

item.author: No author info
item.description: "While I can see the long term value of having Planview (time tracking) in the new world, it takes longer to have a planview ticket created and assigned that it does to get an issue resolved. Something must be done to make IT more agile. "

item.title: "While the service desk is reponsive, the IT team assigned is not able to solve the ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "While the service desk is reponsive, the IT team assigned is not able to solve the tickets."

item.title: "Why am I required to dial 3880? The people there are of no use. When I ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Why am I required to dial 3880? The people there are of no use. When I am locked out of a AS400 (password issue) the 1st response is usually: ""...I'm sorry, your user ID is not supposed to be activated at this time... or some such mess. When I push for a response that makes sense I am placed on hold for what seems like 3 minutes. After I insist on knowing the issue, I get access. The folks at the ""helpdesk"" don't understand issues such as system lockup, and want to ask, what are the other issues? There is one person there who is knowledgeable and professional; unfortunately, I cannot remember his name. When something goes wrong, I do not dial 3880 first; I reboot until something fixes itself, which can be discouraging and is definitely unproductive."

item.title: "Why do we have good computers/monitors sitting on shelves, not being used, when we have people ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: "Why do we have good computers/monitors sitting on shelves, not being used, when we have people struggling with slow, older models? Put the newer Equipment to good use and put the slower ones on the shelves as back-up. Also, put more employees back on-site and stop making us call India. Let us call people who speak English well, like US citizens. "

item.title: Why does our IT help desk calls have to go through India first? Why can't we ...
item.author: No author info
item.description: Why does our IT help desk calls have to go through India first? Why can't we talk to some one here at TDTC directly in order to resolve the issue quicker? It is very difficult for me to understand the current IT arrangement.

He has a great following with us CSE's and we thank him for his assistance. I havent needed him in the past year but knowing he is there is a great relief. "

item.description: "Your use of the survey after every little issue is ridiculous. They waste peoples time that could be better utilized doing their job. Additionally, getting a follow-up reminder to fill out a survey that a person deleted because there was no interest to waste the time filling it out is very annoying. Your surveys should be done randomly and allow for people that have no interest in filling them out, without pestering them. "

item.description: You're making big improvements. Keep it up
